com.gwtplatform.mvp.client
Interface DelayedBind

public interface DelayedBind

Classes implementing that interface are expected to be bound with GIN as eager singletons ({code .asEagerSingleton()}). However, they have an empty constructor and are bound manually when the program starts by calling their delayedBind(Ginjector). Their constructor will typically register themselves with the DelayedBindRegistry, which will take care of calling bind on all the registered classes.

Author:
Philippe Beaudoin

Method Summary
 void delayedBind(Ginjector ginjector)
          Requests that the classes binds all its objects using the Ginjector to get the required instances.
 

Method Detail

delayedBind

void delayedBind(Ginjector ginjector)
Requests that the classes binds all its objects using the Ginjector to get the required instances. This should ever only be called once, typically by DelayedBindRegistry.bind(Ginjector). You should cast the passed Ginjector to your specific Ginjector interface.

Parameters:
ginjector - The Ginjector from which to get object instances.
